name: Annotated Trash
author: Melissa 'elky' Draper

sections.description:
Co-Blogging is fun, until someone loses a comment to someone else’s mouseclick. Communicate the reason that comment is in the trash by adding annotating it!

This module adds a new column to the comments table in which you can enter your reason.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the annotatedtrash tar.gz or zip to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory and unzip or tar xfz it.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
Can I help? What can I do?

My only language is English, so it’d be really helpful to have some people translate Annotated Trash.

Also, try the module out, and submit bugs!
sections.changelog:
0.1.1

  • Annotator name now populates without a page refresh.

0.1

  • It’s a module! All new and stuff. Yay! Please try it out and submit bugs.

short_description: Why is that comment in the trash? If you co-blog, you've probably asked this. The Annotated Trash plugin helps answer that question.
description:
Co-Blogging is fun, until someone loses a comment to someone else’s mouseclick. Communicate the reason that comment is in the trash by adding annotating it!

This module adds a new column to the comments table in which you can enter your reason.

upgrade_notice.0.1.1: • Fix bug with annotator name not populating without a page refresh.

screenshots.caption: The commenting admin interface, with the 'trash' filter selected.
